bio: Bottura is the chef patron of Osteria Francescana, a three-Michelin-starred restaurant in Modena, Italy. He is known for his innovative and avant-garde approach to Italian cuisine, blending traditional ingredients with modern techniques.

recipes.cooking_method: Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions. In a separate pan, cook ground beef, onion, and garlic until beef is browned. Add tomato sauce and simmer for 10 minutes. In a bowl, mix together ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, and parmesan cheese. Layer noodles, beef mixture, and cheese mixture in a baking dish. Bake at 375°F for 25-30 minutes, until cheese is melted and bubbly.

In a pan, cook chicken until browned. Add onion and garlic and cook until softened. Stir in curry powder and cook for 1 minute. Add coconut milk, tomato paste, and lemon juice. Simmer for 10 minutes, until chicken is cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve over rice.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions. In a bowl, mix together ground beef, bread crumbs, egg, milk, parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper. Roll into meatballs and cook in a separate pan until browned. Pour tomato sauce over meatballs and simmer for 10 minutes. Serve over spaghetti.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. In a pan, melt butter and stir in flour. Gradually stir in milk and cook until thickened. Add cheddar cheese and stir until melted. Mix cheese sauce with macaroni and pour into a baking dish. Sprinkle breadcrumbs over the top. Bake at 375°F for 20-25 minutes, until golden brown.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. In a pan, melt butter and stir in flour. Gradually stir in milk and cook until thickened. Add cheddar cheese and stir until melted. Mix cheese sauce with macaroni and pour into a baking dish. Sprinkle breadcrumbs over the top. Bake at 375°F for 20-25 minutes, until golden brown.

bio: Bastianich is an Italian-American chef, television host, and author. She has written several cookbooks and has hosted cooking shows on PBS. Her style of cooking is influenced by the Friuli region of Italy, where she grew up.

bio: Cracco is a Michelin-starred Italian chef who is known for his contemporary approach to Italian cuisine. He has worked in some of Italy's top restaurants, including the famous Enoteca Pinchiorri in Florence.
